Komisi Yudisial Terima 1.139 Laporan Soal Dugaan Pelanggaran Etik Hakim
02 Nov 2019, 00:01 by Bahtiar Rifa'i
Serang - Sepanjang periode Januari-September 2019, Komisi Yudisial (KY) menerima 1.139 laporan masyarakat terkait dugaan pelanggaran kode etik dan perilaku hakim. Banten, menduduki peringkat kesembilan daerah yang banyak dilaporkan terkait kode etik hakim.
Sekjen KY Tubagus Rismunandar Ruhijat mengatakan, ada 31 laporan berasal dari Banten terkait kode etik dan perilaku hakim. Urutan tiga besar diduduki DKI Jakarta sebanyak 248 laporan, Jawa Timur 144 laporan, dan Sumatera Utara 99 laporan.
"Sepanjang Januari-September 2019, Komisi Yudisial (KY) menerima sebanyak 1.139 laporan masyarakat terkait dugaan pelanggaran Kode Etik dan Pedoman Perilaku Hakim atau KEPPH dan 669 surat tembusan," kata Rismunandar Ruhijat di hadapan wartawan saat sosialisasi bersama media massa dari Banten di Kota Serang, Jumat malam (1/11/2019).
Selain itu, daerah Jawa Barat sebanyak 93 laporan, Jawa Tengah 85 laporan, Riau 44 laporan, Sulawesi Selatan 37 laporan, Sumatera Selatan 36 laporan.
Kemudian, berdasarkan jenis peradilan, paling banyak mendominasi menurutnya merupakan peradilan umum 860 laporan, Mahkamah Agung 83 laporan, PTUN 60 laporan, Peradilan Agama 58 laporan dan PHI 20 laporan. Terakhir, peradilan Tipikor sampai 16 laporan.
Untuk sanksi yang diputuskan berdasarkan sidang pleno oleh anggota KY, ada 121 hakim yang terbukti melanggar kode etik dan pedoman perilaku hakim. Di Banten sendiri, ada 3 hakim terlapor yang dinyatakan diberi sanksi ringan berupa pernyataan tidak puas secara tertulis.
"Hingga Agustus 2019 ada 4 hakim yang diajukan dalam sidang Majelis Kehormatan Hakim karena pelanggaran berat dan direkomendasikan KY berupa pemberhentian tetap dengan hak pensiun maupun pemberhentian tetap tidak dengan hormat, yaitu hakim RMA, MYS, SS dan HM," pungkasnya.

Judicial Commission Receives 1,139 Reports on Alleged Violations of Judge Ethics
02 Nov 2019, 00:01 by Bahtiar Rifa'i
Serang - During the period January-September 2019, the Judicial Commission (KY) received 1,139 public reports related to alleged violations of the code of ethics and the behavior of judges. Banten, ranked ninth in the region which is widely reported related to the judge's code of ethics.
KY Secretary General Tubagus Rismunandar Ruhijat said, there were 31 reports coming from Banten related to the code of ethics and the behavior of judges. The top three were occupied by DKI Jakarta with 248 reports, East Java with 144 reports, and North Sumatra with 99 reports.
"During January-September 2019, the Judicial Commission (KY) received 1,139 public reports related to alleged violations of the Code of Ethics and the Code of Conduct for Judges or KEPPH and 669 copies," Rismunandar Ruhijat told reporters during a socialization session with the mass media from Banten in Serang City , Friday night (1/11/2019).
In addition, there were 93 reports in West Java, 85 in Central Java, 44 in Riau, 37 in South Sulawesi, 36 in South Sumatra.
Then, based on the type of justice, the most dominant according to him is the general court 860 reports, the Supreme Court 83 reports, 60 PTUN reports, 58 Religious Courts and 20 reports PHI. Finally, the Corruption Court up to 16 reports.
For sanctions that were decided based on a plenary session by KY members, there were 121 judges who were proven to violate the code of ethics and the judge's code of conduct. In Banten itself, there were 3 reported judges who were stated to be given light sanctions in the form of dissatisfaction statements in writing.
"As of August 2019 there were 4 judges who were presented at the Honorary Panel of Judges for serious violations and KY recommended a permanent dismissal with pension rights or a non-respectable dismissal, namely RMA, MYS, SS and HM judges," he concluded.
